intro: Cacalia sordidopapposa, commonly known as the sordid pappose cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, glandular leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are small and clustered, with ray florets that are usually pale or yellowish in color. The species is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
